title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A tragic love story set in the roaring 1920s, exploring themes of decadence, idealism, social upheaval, and resistance to change.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society, warning of the dangers of government overreach, totalitarianism, and repressive regimentation of all persons and behaviors within society.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
summary: The story of Liesel, a young German girl growing up in Nazi Germany, and her love for books and the power of words.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
summary: A fantasy adventure novel that explores the relationship between faith and reason through the story of a young Indian boy stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

title: The Blind Side
author: Michael Lewis
summary: The story of Michael Oher, a homeless teenager turned first round NFL draft pick with the help of a caring woman and her family.

title: The Wright Brothers
author: David McCullough
summary: A biography of Wilbur and Orville Wright, the inventors of the airplane, detailing their lives, work, and impact on history.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
summary: The exclusive biography of Steve Jobs, based on more than forty interviews with Jobs conducted over two years, as well as interviews with family members, friends, adversaries, competitors, and colleagues.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
summary: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: The first novel in the Harry Potter series, it follows Harry Potter, a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday, when he receives a letter of acceptance to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
summary: The story of a pig named Wilbur and his friendship with a barn spider named Charlotte. When Wilbur is in danger of being slaughtered by the farmer, Charlotte writes messages praising Wilbur in her web in order to persuade the farmer to let him live.

title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit
author: Beatrix Potter
summary: The story of a mischievous young rabbit and his encounter with Mr. McGregor in his vegetable garden.

title: Alice in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
summary: The story of a girl named Alice who falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar, anthropomorphic creatures.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
summary: A thriller novel about a woman who mysteriously disappears on her fifth wedding anniversary, with her husband becoming the prime suspect.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
summary: A mystery novel that follows a journalist and a young computer hacker as they investigate a decades-old disappearance, uncovering a web of corruption and violence.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
summary: A mystery thriller novel that follows symbologist Robert Langdon and cryptologist Sophie Neveu after a murder in the Louvre Museum in Paris causes them to become involved in a battle between the Priory of Sion and Opus Dei over the possibility of Jesus Christ having been married to Mary Magdalene.

title: Shutter Island
author: Dennis Lehane
summary: A psychological thriller set in 1954 that follows U.S. Marshal Teddy Daniels as he investigates a psychiatric facility on Shutter Island after one of the patients goes missing.
